bill_title: list Flunitrazepam and Gamma Hydroxy Butyrate as controlled substances and to provide penalties therefor.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to list Flunitrazepam and Gama Hydroxy Butyrate as Schedule III controlled substances. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 34-20B-20 be amended to read as follows: 34-20B-20. Any material, compound, mixture, or preparation is included in Schedule III which contains any quantity of the following substances having a potential for abuse associated with a depressant effect on the central nervous system: (1) Any substance which contains any quantity of a derivative of barbituric acid, or any salt of a derivative of barbituric acid, except those substances which are specifically listed in other schedules. (2) Chloral betaine (3) Chloral hydrate (4) Chlorhexadol (5) Lysergic acid (6) Lysergic acid amide (7) Methyprylon (8) Sulfondiethylmethane (9) Sulfonethylmethane (10) Sulfonmethane (11) Amobarbital, pentobarbital , and secobarbital in suppository dosage form (12) Flunitrazepam (13) Gama hydroxy butyrate .

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to list Flunitrazepam and Gama Hydroxy Butyrate as controlled substances and to provide penalties therefor. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 34-20B-20 be amended to read as follows: 34-20B-20. Any material, compound, mixture, or preparation is included in Schedule III which contains any quantity of the following substances having a potential for abuse associated with a depressant effect on the central nervous system: (1) Any substance which contains any quantity of a derivative of barbituric acid, or any salt of a derivative of barbituric acid, except those substances which are specifically listed in other schedules. (2) Chloral betaine (3) Chloral hydrate (4) Chlorhexadol (5) Lysergic acid (6) Lysergic acid amide (7) Methyprylon (8) Sulfondiethylmethane (9) Sulfonethylmethane (10) Sulfonmethane (11) Amobarbital, pentobarbital , and secobarbital in suppository dosage form (12) Gama hydroxy butyrate . Section 2. That § 34-20B-25 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SUBDIVISION to read as follows: Flunitrazepam. Section 3. That § 22-42-4 be amended to read as follows: 22-42-4. Except as authorized by this chapter or chapter 34-20B, no person may manufacture, distribute, or dispense a substance listed in Schedule IV; possess with intent to manufacture, distribute, or dispense, a substance listed in Schedule IV; create or distribute a counterfeit substance listed in Schedule IV; or possess with intent to distribute a counterfeit substance listed in Schedule IV. A violation of this section is a Class 6 felony. However, the distribution of a substance listed in Schedule IV to a minor is a Class 4 felony. A first conviction under this section shall be punished by a mandatory sentence in the state penitentiary or county jail of at least thirty days, which sentence may not be suspended. A second or subsequent conviction under this section shall be punished by a mandatory penitentiary or county jail sentence of at least one year, which sentence may not be suspended. A civil penalty may be imposed, in addition to any criminal penalty, upon a conviction of a violation of this section not to exceed ten thousand dollars. Notwithstanding any other provision of this section, a violation of this section with respect to distribution of Flunitrazepam to a minor is a Class 4 felony, but in all other cases under this section is a Class 5 felony. BILL HISTORY 1/12/99 First read in Senate and referred to Judiciary. S.J. 20 1/20/99 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/20/99 Judiciary Do Pass, Passed, AYES 7, NAYS 0. S.J. 125 1/21/99 Senate Do Pass, Passed, AYES 34, NAYS 1. S.J. 149 1/22/99 First read in House and referred to Judiciary. H.J. 131 1/29/99 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/29/99 Judiciary Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 11, NAYS 0. H.J. 263

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to list Flunitrazepam and Gamma Hydroxy Butyrate as controlled substances and to provide penalties therefor. Any material, compound, mixture, or preparation is included in Schedule III which contains any quantity of the following substances having a potential for abuse associated with a depressant effect on the central nervous system: (1) Any substance which contains any quantity of a derivative of barbituric acid, or any salt of a derivative of barbituric acid, except those substances which are specifically listed in other schedules. (2) Chloral betaine (3) Chloral hydrate (4) Chlorhexadol (5) Lysergic acid (6) Lysergic acid amide (7) Methyprylon (8) Sulfondiethylmethane (9) Sulfonethylmethane (10) Sulfonmethane (11) Amobarbital, pentobarbital , and secobarbital in suppository dosage form (12) Gamma hydroxy butyrate . A first conviction under this section shall be punished by a mandatory sentence in the state penitentiary or county jail of at least thirty days, which sentence may not be suspended. A second or subsequent conviction under this section shall be punished by a mandatory penitentiary or county jail sentence of at least one year, which sentence may not be suspended. A civil penalty may be imposed, in addition to any criminal penalty, upon a conviction of a violation of this section not to exceed ten thousand dollars. Notwithstanding any other provision of this section, a violation of this section with respect to distribution of Flunitrazepam to a minor is a Class 4 felony, but in all other cases under this section is a Class 5 felony.
